page.title: 11SCHOOL NOW IN BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: There is only one school in Ballindalloch.It is called Inveravon Primary School and is attended by children between the ages of 4 and 12 who live mainly in the Parish of Inveravon.Secondary pupils attend Speyside High School in nearby Aberlour. Inveravon School is a rural school with 24 pupils meantime and 2 teachers helped by several visiting teachers.Pupils come from a fairly wide area, some travelling as much as 6 miles each way.Because of its situation,the school has a delightful and much-admired view overlooking the Spey valley and the little white church nestling below.In addition to normal educational subjects,the children enjoy activities like computer ,radio and television programmes,sports,swimming,badminton, music,art and handcraft, and dinners!
